verb.description: (especially of a large group of people) rush around in a violent and uncontrollable manner.
examples: several thousand demonstrators rampaged through the city

noun.description: A period of violent and uncontrollable behavior, typically involving a large group of people.
examples: thugs went on a rampage and wrecked a classroom

origin: Late 17th century: perhaps based on the verb ramp and the noun rage.
